title: What is the first thing that a girl looks for in a guy? - Quora
tags: Relationships and Dating of Young People

response.answer_text: Question: “What is the first thing that a girl looks for in a guy?” Notice that the question isn’t “first thing/quality a girl wants in/from a guy”, which is what everyone else has answered. It says LOOKS FOR. Time to put in a technically-correct snarky answer from an unexpected direction then. ANSWER: If the girl isn’t blind, then obviously the first thing she LOOKS for is LOOKS! Because if you’re LOOKING for something you have to be able to SEE it! …Huh, that’s NOT actually me being too literal. Interesting. Well, aesthetics are serious business, more so today than ever before considering online dating is all about swiping on photos. If a woman feels like she has more than a few thousand choices, she’s not going to pay attention outside the top ten or so. Put a bunch of girls together with different preferences and you’ll get maybe the top 100 men covered out of a few thousand. The days of actually getting to know someone as friends and then deciding “I’d like to spend my life (or at least a lot of it) with this person” based on an informed decision are gone. Instead, we have endless chasing of butterflies, fear of missing out, and obsession with always aiming for something better. Fortunately, this means all the rest of us men can reorient our life goals and, if we are capable enough, aim for self-actualization instead of being tied down fulfilling the more basic needs of a family. Women are much more prolific consumers than men, so by keeping men single, this reduces the amount of income which can be spent on consumption (so long as the millions of men living alone keep away from OnlyFans or the likes). we’ll also pollute the environment less. Isn’t it wonderful? EDIT: Obviously there are plenty of exceptions, but it only takes a few percentage points to help protect the environment better. And modern “relationships” already have over 40% meeting online, so… Tinder is helping save the planet. EDIT 2: In case it’s not obvious, if the question was “what do women want in/from men” I’d leave it be because everyone else answered well enough. I’d say reliability, honesty, industriousness, diligence, not being an idiot with money, and enough looks to not be embarrassing to be seen with according to society.

I can’t answer for all women, but this is a basic (what I look for) standard: Kind - if the first impression I have of you isn’t kind or respectful, you probably don’t have a good chance with me.Trustworthy - if I’ve seen you in a relationship where you’re cheating, the relationship probably won't start off very trusting (or start at all).Equal - in a relationship, no one should make all the decisions (in my opinion) i.e., you buy the movie tickets, I’ll buy the concession snacks, etc.Intelligent (this may be just me) - Do I have to explain this one?Willing to put in the work - I want you to “try” in the relationship. if you aren’t feeling it, just tell me, don’t drag it out.Communicative - TALK TO ME. If you don’t want to talk or are unavailable at the moment, don’t leave me on read, just tell me you can’t talk at the moment (respectfully)Confidant (in the relationship) - don’t get jealous if a guy starts talking to me in front of you, I can take care of myself, and if I need help, i’ll tell you.Good Listener - I’ll do the same, just be someone I can talk toSense of Humor - I can laugh at almost anything with someone I enjoy being around, just don’t be offensive and it’s fineGenuinely caring - WANTS to spend time with me and my family, and considers them family. Also just cares for peoples well being (not right away necessarily, but idk…)If anyone gets butthurt over this for some reason, I’m sorry. But these shouldn’t be difficult expectations. Anyone who is a decent human would have at least 9/10 of these. Be a good person, and don’t treat your S/O like shit. (I guess that’s ← what I look for in a guy)
